group_1.textRight: I'm glad you were given a decent room@this time.

group_1.textLeft: They did make some strange requests, but...

group_1.textRight: At first I thought you might be a Rakshasi@survivor who was hiding her identity.
But you really don't seem to know anything…@So that can't be the case, right?
But your strength is the very power@of the Rakshasi, as they say...
It's impossible to be attacked by the Mongolian@Army and come out totally unscathed.
I couldn't do this on my own,@but with your help, I can.

group_1.textLeft: …What?

group_1.textRight: Defeat the Mongolian Army.

group_1.textLeft: That's not…

group_1.textRight: …I know I'm talking nonsense,@that it's something near impossible.
But…If I don't do anything, Heruka will have@to shoulder that burden all alone.
I won't allow it…@That's all I have to say.

group_1.textLeft: ...Even if she asks me to defeat the Mongolian@Army...

group_1.textRight: I guess that's how extraordinary they thought@you were.
That aside, it seems we're keeping someone@waiting.

group_1.textLeft: Eh…?

group_1.textRight: U-um… I brought you some food.
…What were you mumbling to yourself about?
Ah, I'm invisible to everyone else,@so you better make up an excuse.

group_1.textLeft: …You want me to come up with the follow-up?

group_1.textRight: How unusual…

group_1.textLeft: I'm only mumbling to myself because...@[chara:103301:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:103301:eyeClose_1][chara:103301:lipSynch_1]it's…a hobby of mine.

group_1.textRight: [chara:833900:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]A hobby?!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, just a hobby. If you hear me talking to@myself in the future, don't pay it any mind.

group_1.textRight: O-okay…I understand…@Well, um…I'll be going now, okay?
…I suppose it must have seemed strange,@since you were actually mumbling…

group_1.textLeft: If I had known someone was there,@I would have used telepathy...
More importantly, I was wondering...@Are we out of sync with the original history?

group_1.textRight: Well… Here's a brief summary of the history@that Big Sister followed…

group_1.narration: "In this nunnery there was a person@who was called a Rakshasi...
"She ended the war between@Tibet and Mongolia, and…"

group_1.textRight: …This is the proper history.@There is no mention of "Junior Nuns."

group_1.textLeft: What does Tamaki have to say about@the nunnery?

group_1.textRight: It's simply regarded as a monastery for children@who have no relatives.

group_1.textLeft: It's not the same at all…@As if history is completely out of sync.

group_1.textRight: The other thing I'm curious about@is the Rakshasi.
Why didn't Big Sister record her name?

group_1.textLeft: If what Dolma said was true…
Then I think Rakshasi must be Heruka.
Considering that…@I shouldn't help Dolma with her plan.

group_1.textRight: It would be an unnecessary change to history.
…There's no way to prevent Heruka@from becoming a Magical Girl.
It would be rewriting the past,@which is something we mustn't do.

group_1.textLeft: ...I understand.

group_1.textRight: So long as you do, it's fine.

group_1.textLeft: (...In the end, we must remain bystanders.)
(I thought I'd had enough of this…)

group_1.textRight: But what has caused this discrepancy@remains a mystery.

group_1.textLeft: The nunnery was already completely different@before we entered the scene…
Something that could cause such variance…@Could it be a Witch?

group_1.textRight: A Witch?

group_1.textLeft: When the Mongolian Army attacked us,@I felt the presence of a Witch.
Maybe it caused something to go wrong@with the course of history here.

group_1.textRight: I doubt a Witch could do that much.

group_1.textLeft: …Is that so? There are so many things@I don't understand…
(Such as where Sasha and the others are.@And about Heruka herself…)
